guidedTour.step.general.guidedTour.text:
Hello!
I see you are new around here! If you want a tour of our features click next
If you are not in the mood right now you can access this at any time using the help icon in the left. Each page has a specific tour so check it out on different pages.
guidedTour.step.chainPage.latestBlock.te: Quickly review key stats for the latest block (including its identification number and total number of processed transactions). Clicking on the block’s number opens a page with full details about it. Select which metric you want highlighted and switch anytime between the graphic & the standard view.
guidedTour.step.chainPage.blocksList.tex: This is where we show the latest blocks mined, in chronological order (newest at top). Each circle is a component transaction and their size reflects their relative value, compared with all other transactions within the block. We use green to highlight the top 20% transactions (in terms of value exchanged). Hover or click on a circle to see full details. Hovering on a set of circles gives you key indicators about the block they are grouped in.
guidedTour.step.blockPage.basicData.text: Welcome to the block view! This first section contains basic information about a block - its identification number, time since it was mined, uncles (the Ethereum equivalent of Bitcoin’s orphan blocks) and a visual comparison between the number of transactions which did and did not call on a smart contract.
guidedTour.step.blockPage.txs.text:
So what does this block contain? That is what we show you in this visual representation of transactions within the block. You can see the total number of transactions and highlight their various indicators. The size of the circles here indicates their relative value, compared to that of all other transactions in the block. Hovering over any of the circles will display individual information, such as Tx address, value and wallet addresses involved.
You can also switch to a standard, table view by clicking on the striped button at the top.
guidedTour.step.blockPage.cms.text: This section contains information about the miner who processed this block and its performance. You can see the duration, gas cost, difficulty and reward given.
guidedTour.step.blockPage.logsBloom.text:
This is a summary of all transactions within this block, highlighting their associated logs (if any).
You can read more about this parameter here - https://ethon.consensys.net/prop-blocklogsbloom.html
guidedTour.step.blockPage.asideList.text: This is a visual representation of how this particular block performed against blocks mined immediately before and after it. The graph takes into account only the total number of transactions included in the block.
guidedTour.step.txPage.basicData.text: Welcome to the transaction view! This is the primary information associated with this particular transaction. It shows its current value (in ETH and USD), the block in which it was included, as well as the issuing and receiving accounts (their addresses can be copied if you wish to look them up).
guidedTour.step.txPage.gasData.text: As gas costs are what fuels the network, this section gives you a perspective into the costs of this specific transaction, as well as background information about gas consumption throughout the entire network.
guidedTour.step.txPage.summary.text: Public details about the contents of this transaction are stored here and you can view them separately. Our graph module helps you better visualise this information - just click on this button to activate it.
guidedTour.step.txPage.asideList.text:
To give you context, we’re displaying the map of the block from which this transaction originates. You can instantly navigate to another transaction from this block, by clicking on its corresponding circle.
The size of each circle suggests the relative value of the transaction, compared with all others within the block.
guidedTour.step.cmPage.basicData.text: This is the fundamental information about this specific contract message. It includes its ID, value, associated transaction and account and gas cost performance.
guidedTour.step.cmPage.asideList.text:
The resulting contract message can be viewed and copied from here.
The vertical graphic displays all contract messages within the associated transaction. The size of the circles represented here reflects the relative value exchange, compared with other contract messages within this transaction.
guidedTour.step.accountPage.basicData.te: Exploring an account’s activity on the network starts with the basics: address, portfolio (expressed in ETH and USD using real time exchange value), content distribution (currency vs tokens) and a link to the external account (via the QR code).
guidedTour.step.accountPage.graphData.te: Get a quick overview of the account’s balance in each of the previous 30 days and see the evolution of its portfolio. It’s current balance is updated below, along with its value calculated in USD.
guidedTour.step.accountPage.txs.text:
This is a summary of incoming, outgoing and pending transactions associated with this account. The table below displays detailed information about all transactions occurring in this account, in chronological order (newest to oldest). View a specific type of transaction by using the 3 filters here.
Contracts displayed here also feature their source code, ABIs, account code and arguments. Simply scroll below to access these details.
guidedTour.step.general.search.text: If you want to see details about a specific transaction, block or account just type its hash number in this search box.
guidedTour.step.general.netStats.text: Our complementary product, EthStats Network Statistics, gives you a bird’s-eye view of the current status - load, health, activity - of the Ethereum network. Clicking on this button will redirect you to its dedicated domain.
guidedTour.step.general.feedback.text: We need all the feedback you can give us so share your thoughts here and help us make EthStats even better for you. Adblockers may prevent you from seeing our feedback form so please turn them off for this purpose.
guidedTour.step.general.alethio.text: Find out more about our team, projects and vision on Alethio’s official website.
guidedTour.step.dashboardPage.blocksList: Check our quick overview of the latest activity on the Ethereum blockchain. The horizontal graphic displays the 50 most recent blocks, highlighting the number of transactions included in each one. We also show you the number of the latest mined block, time passed since the last processed transaction and how many transactions and uncles were included in this set.
guidedTour.step.dashboardPage.pendingPoo: Transactions waiting to be processed by miners are temporarily stored in the Pending Pool. The graph shows the average time that a transaction waits to be mined. Based on the total number of pending transactions stored, we calculate the average ETH value added per second and the average number of tokens transferred per second.
guidedTour.step.dashboardPage.netstatsSe:
This graph shows the evolution of transactions as they have been propagated by miners to active nodes. The total number of nodes, displayed here, directly correlates with the propagation speed (how fast they were broadcasted to other nodes in the blockchain). To offer perspective on the efficiency on the network, we also calculate the percentage of transactions to which this propagation speed applies.
EthStats Network Statistics offers more insights into network performance.
privacyPolicy.subLogo.title: Privacy Policy
cookieBanner.label: Cookie Policy
cookieBanner.text: By using this site, you agree to our use of cookies, which we use to analyse our traffic in accordance with our %sPrivacy Policy%s . We also share information about your use of our site with our analytics partners
